Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 04:38PM - edited May 13, 2010 04:56PM by jdfnj2 Do you have a good relationship with your primary doc? - Maybe the PA isnt really allowed to give them out as a rule in that practice - and she is just stalling you.  I ask about your primary - because i was orinally told i wouldnt get my results until my follow up apt - which isnt till the 18th.  I called my primary and freaked - she said she would get the results for me within 5 days of the surgery.  Maybe your primary can contact the lab at the hospital for you? Jen

Posts.Content: May 22, 2010 06:35AM jdfnj2 wrote: Kymber - i received a Birads 4 as well.  It basically means that a biopsy will be needed to make sure everything is ok.  Once something suspicious is found, they want to examine both breasts fully to  make sure there's nothing they left out or missed.  Good luck on Monday and keep us posted. Jen

Posts.Title: Dr.'s words: "I am more concerned than not concerned" ebarb mom3band1g

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 07:10PM jdfnj2 wrote: Kellie I dont think they will be able to tell just by the exam itself.  They usually take a lot of things into account when you go for the exam.  Family history, personal history of lumps / breast issues, age, and how the lump presents / symptoms and appearance.  If they feel it warrants more investigation, they will send you for a diagnostic mammo / u/s.  When I went, i asked my doctors what they thought the lump was - and what the chances were.  I asked about the diagnostic progress as far as, who i would be seeing for care / follow up.  Good luck and keep us posted.  Feel free to private message me if I can help you with any questions, or if you would like to talk - vent. Jen
Posts.Title: Breast Lump Kellie Kellie

Posts.Content: May 2, 2010 06:26PM jdfnj2 wrote: Birad is a rating given by the radiologist after a mammo and ultrasound.  It basically rates how suspicious your findings where and therefore - what  if any, further testing is recommended.

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 09:52PM jdfnj2 wrote: Kwolf - i am scheduled for the same surgery on Monday.  The radiologist told me i have "busy boobs" ........i had two masses detected on the left, a cluster of calcifications on the right and swollen lymph nodes on both sides.  I had the two masses and nodes biopsied two weeks ago - all wonderfully benign.  Now i'm trying to mentally prepare for part two of all this.  I feel much like you do - one minute i'm ok and the next im a mess.  Everyone around me was celebrating my first results, and im just not ready for that.  Like im waiting for the other shoe to drop...........Believe me i know how hard the waiting is.  They originally scheduled the surgical biopsy for May 20th!!!  I told them i would be in a rubber room by then - and my pcp actually put in a call to the surgeon for me.  For me - trying to stay busy with my son is the best disctraction.  But i know what you're saying - i went in for my preop stuff yesterday so its all become quite "real" now.....Just hang in there, we will both make it through this - Whatever the outcome.  A lot of women have posted on here that treatment for cancer was alot easier than the not knowing stage.......so thats saying something about how difficult this all is.  I feel your pain, and alot of women on here do.  Feel free to PM me if you'd like to talk, or have any questions.  Keep the faith, and please keep us posted. Jen

Posts.Title: Mammo showed "busy breasts" Maureen517 jdfnj

Posts.Content: May 11, 2010 08:28PM jdfnj2 wrote: Merri - i just went through 5 biopsys 3 fine needle aspirations, 1 core and one surgical.  Two of the fna's were on lymph nodes exactly as you describe - on both sides.  They came back benign, and after asking several docs about them and doing alot of reading - nodes can swell for tons of reasons.  It could be something as stupid as allergies!!  If mine remain swollen, i will insist on further testing.  But since they came back benign, im not that worried.  As far as my docs told me, its not unusual for the nodes to show up on ultrasound - so it totally makes sense.  Keep us posted. Jen
Posts.Title: Lymph Nodes on Ultrasound? Melimerri MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2010 10:03PM jdfnj2 wrote: Grace - I have lots of issues with lymph nodes.  It started when i was 24, and had sharp pains behind the nipple area.  Ultrasound showed the lymph node.  Fast foward to just two months ago, i had swollen lymph nodes under each arm, lumps, and calcifications to boot - in both breasts.  I had about 6 biopsys, and everything turned out ok.  They biopsied all the nodes to be sure.  Good luck and keep us posted. Jen
